basics.name: Mark Nemec
basics.summary: I'm a 4th year Computer Science student at the University of Edinburgh.

work.summary: I got into the internship programme in 2013 and was offered a part-time position for the next year. In summer 2014 I returned as an intern. Most of the work revolved around writing and maintaining scrapers for airlines but I got involved in several interesting projects.
highlights: Price parsing algorithm that can deal with most currencies and price formats
Script fetching many concurrent requests using Python 3 asyncio library
Worked with multiple web frameworks: Flask, Django, Angular

work.summary: I worked part-time on multiple Django apps with Danger Farms while in the 2nd year of university. This is where I learned how to work with web frameworks and became proficient in Python.

I worked on a prototype for an Android app called tourcentrope. The app was aimed at tourism on the borders of Slovakia, Czech Republic, Austria and Hungary. I worked on all aspects of the app - from architecture to user interface.
A website I created and designed for a mountain-biking project in Štiavnické Vrchy mountain range in Slovakia.

volunteer.summary: The aim of the project was to help upkeep buildings of various religions and meet people from different cultures.

awards.title: Netcraft Prize
awards.summary: The Netcraft Prizes are awarded to the 6 undergraduate students with best performance in third year.

awards.title: Best Game Prize
awards.summary: Manager and developer of a team that was awarded the prize for the best game.
